reference.title: Kokyu tanden ho
reference.shortdesc: Breath power (kokyu) throw or exercise (ho) from kneeling position (seiza)

section.p: Nage and Uke sit opposite each other in seiza, about a fists-width apart. Nage presents both wrists to Uke, who grabs both wrists and pushes them toward Nage in an attempt to push him over backward. Nage resists and then raises his arms up and toward Uke's head. Nage spreads his hands, cutting upward with one hand and down and back with the other, drawing Uke sideways. Nage raises into keiza and draws Uke onto his back and pins Uke by the wrist and outside shoulder. Nage maintains a straight back and projects his ki through his arms to maintain the pin. Uke attempts to rise and taps when he feels his is completely immobilized.

image.alt: Uke seated in seiza, Nage in keiza, Nage beginning to throw Uke sideways.
